title: I am facing 221(g) administrative processing for H1B stamping. What are the chances of getting approved?
content:
I had my H1B visa interview last week at the US Consulate in Chennai, India. The consular officer asked me a few questions about my background and job role, and then gave me a 221(g) blue slip saying they need additional administrative processing. The status on the CEAC portal shows 'Administrative Processing'.

My concerns:
- How long does this typically take?
- What are the chances of getting approved after 221(g)?
- Should I expect additional questions or document requests?
- Can I track the status online?

I am a software engineer with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, 5 years of experience, and have been working for a Fortune 500 company for the past 2 years. The job role is Software Engineer II with salary $125,000.

Please share your experiences if anyone has gone through similar administrative processing for H1B.

title: H1B transfer denied - received RFE for specialty occupation. Need help!
content:
My H1B transfer was denied by USCIS and I received an RFE (Request for Evidence) for specialty occupation. I am currently working for Company A on H1B and was trying to transfer to Company B.

Details:
- Current H1B: Valid until June 2025
- New Position: Software Developer at Company B
- Salary: $105,000/year
- Education: Bachelor's in Information Technology
- Experience: 6 years in software development

The RFE states that the position may not qualify as a specialty occupation. I need to submit additional evidence within 30 days.

What kind of documentation should I provide to strengthen my case?
- Should I get an expert opinion letter?
- What if the new company doesn't have other H1B employees?
- Is there any way to expedite the response?

Has anyone successfully responded to a similar RFE? Please share your experience and any tips.

title: B1/B2 visa interview scheduled for business travel - what documents should I bring?
content:
I have my B1/B2 visa interview scheduled at the US Consulate in Mumbai next month. I am traveling to attend a technology conference and meet with potential business partners.

Background:
- Indian passport holder
- Working as Senior Product Manager at a tech company
- Salary: $95,000
- No prior US travel history
- Planning to stay for 5 days

I have prepared the following documents:
1. Interview appointment letter
2. Form DS-160 confirmation page
3. Passport (valid for 6+ months)
4. Invitation letter from conference organizers
5. Company leave letter
6. Bank statements (last 6 months)
7. Property documents
8. Employment verification letter

Questions:
- Are there any additional documents I should bring?
- What are the typical questions asked during B1/B2 interview?
- How long does the decision take?
- Should I dress formally for the interview?

Please share your experiences with B1/B2 visa interviews.

title: F1 visa denied - need help understanding the reason and reapplication strategy
content:
I appeared for my F1 visa interview at the US Consulate in Delhi for my Master's program in Computer Science at a top US university. Unfortunately, my visa was denied under section 214(b) for lack of immigrant intent.

Background:
- Completed Bachelor's in Engineering with 8.2 GPA
- 2 years work experience as Software Engineer
- Admitted to MS Computer Science program
- University ranking: Top 50 in US
- I-20 shows financial support for 2 years
- Strong ties to India: Own house, stable job, family

During the interview (which lasted only 2 minutes), the consular officer asked:
1. Why do you want to study in the US?
2. Why not study in India?
3. What are your plans after graduation?

I answered all questions honestly, but still got denied.

Questions:
1. What could be the reason for denial despite strong profile?
2. Should I reapply immediately or wait?
3. How can I strengthen my application?
4. Should I get a lawyer for reapplication?

I am really devastated as this was my dream. Any advice would be appreciated.

title: H1B visa revoked - received notice from USCIS. What are my options?
content:
I received a notice from USCIS that my H1B visa has been revoked effective immediately. The notice cites section 212(n)(2)(C) regarding employer-employee relationship issues.

Current situation:
- H1B was valid until December 2025
- Working for a consulting company
- Client project ended 2 months ago
- Company says they will find new project
- Currently on bench (no active project)

Questions:
1. What does 'employer-employee relationship' mean in H1B context?
2. Can I transfer to another employer while on bench?
3. What is the grace period after H1B revocation?
4. Should I leave the US immediately?
5. Can I apply for H1B transfer to a different company?

My company says they will help with the process, but I'm worried about my status. I have been in the US for 3 years and don't want to return to India now.

Looking for urgent advice on next steps.

title: OPT extension denied - received RFE for STEM degree verification
content:
My OPT extension was denied by USCIS and I received an RFE asking for verification that my degree qualifies as STEM.

Background:
- Completed MS in Software Engineering
- Degree is from an accredited US university
- STEM CIP code: 11.0101 (Computer and Information Sciences)
- University is certified under the Student and Exchange Visitor Program
- I have been working with E-Verify employer

The RFE states that they need additional documentation to verify that my degree meets STEM requirements.

What documents should I submit?
1. Official university transcript showing STEM degree
2. Copy of degree certificate
3. University's STEM designation letter
4. I-20 with STEM extension
5. Employment verification letter

Timeline:
- OPT expired 3 days ago
- 30-day response period for RFE
- Currently working (EAD card still valid)

Has anyone successfully responded to STEM degree verification RFE? What was your experience?

title: Green card EB2 application stuck - no response from USCIS for 18 months
content:
I filed my EB2 green card application (I-140 and I-485 concurrently) in May 2023 and haven't received any response from USCIS for 18 months. The case status shows 'Case is actively being reviewed'.

Background:
- EB2 with National Interest Waiver (NIW)
- Advanced degree in Computer Science
- PhD in Machine Learning
- Published 15+ research papers
- Working for a major tech company
- PERM was approved in April 2023

Timeline:
- I-140 PD: May 2023
- I-485 PD: May 2023
- EAD card approved: July 2023
- No response since August 2023
- Current priority date is current for EB2

Questions:
1. Is 18 months normal processing time for EB2 with NIW?
2. Should I contact USCIS or my congressman?
3. Can I expedite the application?
4. What if my employment authorization expires?
5. Any chance of rejection after such a long wait?

I'm considering switching jobs but worried about maintaining my status. Looking for advice on next steps.

title: H1B lottery results 2025 - Selected! But employer is not ready to file
content:
Great news! I got selected in the H1B lottery for 2025. However, my current employer (a small consulting company) is hesitant to file my H1B petition.

Situation:
- H1B selected in lottery (first time applying)
- Employer says filing cost is too high ($5000+)
- They want me to find a new employer willing to sponsor
- Current job: Software Developer, $85,000/year
- Experience: 4 years in development
- Education: Bachelor's in Computer Science

Questions:
1. Can I transfer H1B to a new employer after selection?
2. How long do I have to file after lottery selection?
3. What if I can't find a sponsoring employer?
4. Should I look for companies that regularly sponsor H1B?
5. Any tips for networking to find H1B employers?

I am really excited about the selection but worried about the employer situation. Any advice would be helpful!
